website_summaries.verdict: While this drive may be physically tiny, it can store a ton of files. Put a key ring on it to help in removing it and keep track of it when it’s not in use.
pros: Large storage size in a super-small body
The low profile is great for laptop users who worry about accidentally breaking off their drive
cons: The physical size can also be a problem, as some users might find this drive hard to remove from the computer, as well as easy to lose

customer_reviews.title: Heat, stability and life longevity issues result poor performance or replacements, excellent support and replacement policy
customer_reviews.text: As many of the other reviewers state, these drives suffer from high heat issues. I bought 4 of these on special, and the 3 that I've used stopped working. In some cases, they would only work in certain ports on a specific machine and as soon as I plugged it into another computer it couldn't read the drive. I do not recommend getting replacements from Amazon. If you'll start the RMA process through SanDisk they will replace it for the price of shipping it to them (I recommend putting it in a regular envelope with a little padding). A few weeks later and SanDisk replaced each of mine with a larger better performing flash drive.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Walker

customer_reviews.title: lava destroys everything
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to move large files conveniently but from the start i had issues. File transfer started good then slowed down and it ran hot. I was ok with that because of the capacity of the flash drive but when I actually transferred the file to the new computer, the files didn't work. Word, excel files, all small ones transferred ok but anything over 1gb was a waste. Of all the products i've bought on Amazon, this is the worst. I would only recommend this product as a disk cleaning program. I must say that i have other scandisk products which are excellent,just not this one.
customer_reviews.author: Hayden Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: HEAT ISSUES... BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 3 of these drives. Everyone get hot... very hot. As they say... heat kills. Well it must... all 3 have died over the last 3 to 6 months. I used these in my vehicles for MP3 music. I have seen posts of other people having this drive get hot and burn up their USB port on their computer (I can believe it). Never again... cheap or not these are crap.... I purchased a couple similar sized Lexar models and they never get hot. Something is wrong with the design of this model.
customer_reviews.author: Brett DeWees

customer_reviews.title: Hilariously unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Please be aware that when you buy these you are *not* getting the metal 3.0 editions, rather the newer USB 3.1 units which are a black plastic. The plastic units fail extremely easy even under light usage. The drive will go into "write protected" mode making it so, at best, you can access your data, at worst, completely fail. Supposedly this is not a bug, but rather a "feature" to protect the drive. There's no way to make it return to a normal mode.
customer_reviews.author: Karen S

customer_reviews.title: Slow Transfer Speeds and Overheats
customer_reviews.text: Transfer speeds are on the order of 2 MB/s (or even much lower) instead of the 640 MB/s that transfers should occur over USB 3.0. This is substantially slower than a properly working usb 2.0 device that would transfer at about 60 MB/s. The usb stick gets very hot to the point where it can hurt to hold. Definitely would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: mattgto

customer_reviews.title: Overheating and Dropped Connection Issues
customer_reviews.text: Aside from the overheating issue, both the 128GB Ultra Fit (Old and New Versions) and the newer 256GB Ultra Fit, when used with a USB 3.x connection have a habit of dropping that connection. Unfortunately, I own multiples of these and for the most part they worked fine when connected to a USB 2.x hub, however on USB 3.x, dropped connections almost a given. The only up side to this issue, is that SanDisk has honored their guarantee. I've previously returned two and have two more drives, pending RMAs. ]
customer_reviews.author: Scott M.

customer_reviews.title: Extreme Heat
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE!!! While I like the small form factor, this thing gets extremely hot, after being plugged in for a very short time of use. Whatever port or accessory you plug it in is also going to get extremely hot, and may even cause damage to the port. When unplugging, the metal can get hot enough to burn your fingers. I initially thought I had a faulty port that may have been causing the extreme heat, but I have used it on several different types of devices, with the same results. I do not recommend leaving this plugged into any device, as it may cause severe overheating to the port.
customer_reviews.author: Rod J

customer_reviews.title: SanDisk still doing things right.
customer_reviews.text: Working great. I ordered this as I really like SanDisk products as they have always done me well. I ordered without reading any reviews since I have had good experiences, so they have earned some loyalty. However, when the flash drive was in shipping I started reading reviews, and many stated this drive gets really hot. I was very concerned, so the first thing I did was a file transfer of about 5-6GB of files. Guess what...I touched the drive, and.....room temp. Not hot at all. The drive is now in my truck playing music for me just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 5 months of light use
customer_reviews.text: Bought in September 2016, failed 5 months later in February 2017. Would not recommend to anybody. Wish the seller would refund this product. Obviously defective and probably a knock off. Disappointed. How convenient that returns are only eligible until one month after, while it fails not much longer after the end of returns deadline. Planned obsolescence at its finest.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: This is the first bad review that I have ever written
customer_reviews.text: This is the first bad review that I have ever written. These drives get excessively hot. Once heated they throttle badly and you lose performance. I will be sending them back. It was an incredibly poor design decision to have a plastic wrap around the only exposed part of the drive. That literally traps all of the heat in. Likely, they did that to maintain the "Acceptable" temperature for consumer contact, but at the end of the day, this drive is unserviceable.
customer_reviews.author: ElCid79

customer_reviews.title: Flash Drive became Read Only
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Drive on Amazon in 2016 . I had been using it on my Mac and backing up a lot of content . Just recently the Drive became Read only . I can no longer add or delete Files. There is no setting on the Drive for Write Protection . Well after several Emails to Sandisk they accepted my Warranty Request and sent me a RMA Shipping label . The trouble is I have a lot of Private Information on the Drive . I can not Erase or reformat the Drive using the Disk Utility . I'm not going to send the Drive back for Security reasons . I'm stuck with a Read only Flash Drive.
customer_reviews.author: T. Markson

customer_reviews.title: Good fit for Wii U
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly as expasion drive space for Ninetendo Wii U -- dropped it in, formatted it via the Wii U, and copied data right over. The Wii U complains that it may be slower -- but as far as I can tell Super Smash Bros loads and plays just as well as local storage. Also -- it does not block the other usb port while inserted.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Small size, large capacity... a little slow.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing small and huge in storage. The price point is fantastic. Speed wise it leaves something to be desired. I 've got it filled up about 75% and just added another 14GB worth of pictures. Going from a 7200RPM drive to this took about 25 minutes for 14GB. Conversely, I had just copied those 14GB from my phone to the 7200RPM drive and it took a matter of minutes. So it's definitely not super speedy, but I'm using it as a picture archive, and for that, I can't complain too much.
customer_reviews.author: C.J.

customer_reviews.title: Seriously hot!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these things. The only defense I have for this mistake is that I obviously didn't take one out before letting it cool down. I'm not concerned by the poor transfer speed that others have mentioned. My main concern is that the heat they generate might actually damage the ports on my computers. I would appreciate an engineer's comment on this. The generally good reviews are most likely based on the incredibly small size for such a large capacity. That is why I bought them and, since I don't have any toddlers around, they are not a choking hazard. They are, however, a serious misplacement hazard.
customer_reviews.author: Orlando Furioso

customer_reviews.title: Came in with one big issue.....
customer_reviews.text: Brand new in packaging. It is a 64GB card which is on the item itself. Computer on showed HALF. Fortunately, I have more knowledge than most and got back the rest of the space. Someone INTENTIONALLY partitioned this drive before it was packaged. It's VERY small so you have to keep up with it. I would NOT use this for important info and after finding out how the storage was brand new.....not buying from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: B. Mason

customer_reviews.title: Super Compact & Works with Roku
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 128GBs, USB 3.0 (FAST), Compatible with Windows/Mac, Compact, Compatible with Roku (allows playback of video/audio) Cons: Attached hook broke, can be difficult to grip Bought this to store video and audio on my Roku while also not changing my Roku's design with a huge USB stick. I plugged it in, converted it to exFat format and was able to easily add my media to it. Once I finished I was able to view said media on the Roku with no playback troubles and it kept my desired resolution. I do wish there was a 256GBs version but I guess I must wait for the future. Overall, I would recommend this to anyone who doesn't easily lose small devices/objects.
customer_reviews.author: sharper821

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had read the reviews on Amazon about ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had read the reviews on Amazon about heating issues before buying this flash drive. I simply will not use a flash drive that can heat up to 120 F. This is too hot for a laptop USB 3 port. I have an expensive MacBook and did not want to take a chance with the heat issue. I returned this and decided to buy the Samsung 128 GB flash drive. I don't mind if it is slightly slower than the ScanDisk one. At least it is safer to use. I did not want to take a chance of opening these from packaging and then not able to return them.
customer_reviews.author: sjr

customer_reviews.title: Very Slow and Getting Overheated
customer_reviews.text: When I used this drive, I had noticed the distinct lack of speed as well as the heating issue. I was too preoccuiped to followup. I use this drive as a backup and dont use this frequently. THere was a need to read & write from the drive in the last 3 weeks - the issues relating to the speed are real. The write speed is slower than the USB 2 drives, even if the files are large 200 MB or so. I now understand that a number of users face this issue. Should I initiate a RMA? Natraj
customer_reviews.author: Natraj Kumar C

customer_reviews.title: Overheats my Mac -- I was advised to no longer use!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the large size so I could have it always plugged in my Macbook Air (I have a 512GB SSD but figured having extra storage at all times would be nice) but was advised to not risk my laptop and stop using, not only as I could potentially lose all the data stored on the stick but as my computer could be damaged. Such a shame!
customer_reviews.author: val

customer_reviews.title: Too hot to handle, unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Bought for size and speed. Runs very hot. Stopped working after a few months. To clarify, I bought to record video from a video game recorder. After a few months I started noticing lots of dropped frames. Then I began to notice copying files *TO* the drive would fail. Now when I plug it in to my PC, it will randomly disconnect. Just for grins, I tried doing a surface scan, and it failed with a random disconnect. I can't help but think the heat played a role in this. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: David Hobbs

customer_reviews.title: SanDisk Ultra Fit 32GB USB 3.0 Flash Drive
customer_reviews.text: I purchased three of these flash drives because these are hard to find as their new replacements are made from plastic. These are perfect for music storage to use in our car. When I upload music to them they get very hot. The small plastic flash drives become brittle and crack after a short period. I highly recommend them for media storage for use in your car audio system.
customer_reviews.author: Doyle Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Fine but causes WiFi interference in router.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use on my router as I didn't want to have a regular thumb that sticks out... I got the USB 3.0 because it was cheaper than the 2.0... Bad idea for the application. Even though the router is only USB 2.0, apparently the USB 3.0 in the drive causes interference with the 5.0 MHz WiFi radio in the router. DOH!! Going to get the USB 2.0 version and swap it, then use this one for my car for music.
customer_reviews.author: Andew S.

customer_reviews.title: Gets so hot it makes the speed pointless
customer_reviews.text: SanDisk may claim that they follow the industry standards, but obviously other companies have a higher standard. SanDisk: I have other USB 3.0 flash drives of similar size which don't heat up nearly as much. You can follow the "industry standard" but surely you can do better with higher standards. These get way too hot. They may be fast at first, but they get slow (slower than USB 2.0) as they heat up. And they heat up fast! I would say that they get too hot to touch for more than a moment.
customer_reviews.author: Tectix

customer_reviews.title: This drive is a joke! Speeds are not as ...
customer_reviews.text: This drive is a joke! Speeds are not as advertised AT ALL! Here are the Crystal Disk results for this drive. Out of the box it was formatted FAT32. I reformatted it with exFAT(128kb sectors) and this is the speed. I also tried it with NTFS (4096bytes) results weren't much different.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Brown

customer_reviews.title: Mean, Nasty, Little Thing
customer_reviews.text: Hey, I'm a computer consultant; and, have never previously encountered anything like this. These devices are good only for VERY short-period usage. Longer use causes them to seriously overheat, to the point they literally scald fingers upon touch. Immediately before that, they lock up not only the device itself; but, also throw even high-end W10 boxes into out-of-memory warning and even lock-up and problem-reporting states. Don't put critical, large files on these, as retrieval will be more than problematic. Cute they are. Effective they are not. ScanDisk truly failed on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Back-up Guy

customer_reviews.title: Heat and failure on multiple machines in a normal environment
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea how this particular product has such a high rating with this many people experiencing the same issue: Heat and failure. Device easily reaches 140F while transferring files. Mine failed at this temperature less than 2 minutes after starting the transfer. I tried this on two separate machines both with USB 3.0 (One being a desktop machine, the other being a MBP 15" Mid-2015.) I measured the temperature using a infrared thermometer. Room temp was 74F. I've initiated a return for it and will instead go for a product that doesn't have heat issues. No offense, SanDisk, but this particular product isn't working out.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Jones

customer_reviews.title: Size is good for price, but compatibility, performance, and heat is drawback
customer_reviews.text: Good storage for the price. A couple of downsides, one of my computers just doesn't see this drive at all...not sure exactly why, but it just won't see it. Also, this little puppy gets hot...so hot that you'd think it would melt at some point. I think someone could actually get burned if you were reading/writing to this. One other downside is that for USB 3.0 it doesn't seem as fast as my other USB 3.0 drives...on those I can get upwards of 400MB/s, but with the same block size I get much less. I would probably get something different next time.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: And like many have reported
customer_reviews.text: I wish i could give it 0 star. The usb drive arrived completely squished in the middle, causing the metal nearly touched in the center. Tried to carefully fix it (dumb move, should've sent it back immediately), and was able to insert it but was not able to format it. And like many have reported, this unit runs extremely hot after just 2 minutes. I also noticed the little plastic cap for the drive was melted and cannot be used with the drive. This is by far one of my worst experience on Amazon, but thanks god it's only a $10 unit.
customer_reviews.author: Lori D.

customer_reviews.title: No longer recognized in USB 3.0 ports
customer_reviews.text: Hadn't even really used this. It was sitting unused for a while, then when I plug it into my 3.0 port, it's not recognized. The Ultra Fit flashes once, then nothing. Tried all three USB 3.0 ports on my MSI, no luck, so tried my Lenovo, no luck, tried another Lenovo, no luck. Then I happened to try a USB 2.0 port, and the drive now shows, however, it's a USB 2.0 port, so not the speeds I purchased the unit for. It's been a while since purchase, so I'm stuck with this little chicklet, and I don't trust it enough to use it in the 2.0 port. Oh well...
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: To HOT to handle!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of the Sandisk Ultra Fit 32GB USB3.0 drives. I am very concerned as to how hot they became when plugged into a USB3.0 socket. The metal parts of the sticks get extremely hot after only a few minutes of operation. If I remove the flash drive from the host 3.0 socket the flash drive metal plug will burn my fingers. I have never seen flash drives get that hot and fear the excessive heat will damage both the flash drive and the host computer socket. SanDisk needs to take this product off the market.
customer_reviews.author: JT Martin

customer_reviews.title: Terribly Slow Write Speeds, Too Hot to Handle and Cheap Plastic, NOT Metal
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these to store music on for my Mazda Infotainment system. What I received is NOT what was pictured in the ad, they run very hot and are terribly slow to write to. The items I ordered sell for $10.98 each and have a metal connector, but the items I actually received are cheap plastic models that sell for $6.98 here on Amazon. I returned them and ordered two replacements. The replacements shipped to me were the same slow, cheap plastic items I'd returned the first time. I've shipped those back and ordered Samsung products instead. They are much faster than the SanDisk sticks, have a strong metal housing and run much cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Braun

customer_reviews.title: Like it a lot, great flash drive!
customer_reviews.text: I like it very much. Using it on my smaller 13.3-inch laptop with 128 GB SSD Drive, as a second drive for storage. So I get a double storage space for an affordable price on my laptop PC. Also, it's convenient when transferring files onto other PCs or USB devices. Yes, as other reviewers noted, it gets pretty hot when transferring large multi-GB files. Still, I don't consider it a serious drawback. I rarely transfer anything more than 5 GB at one time and never had any problems with it. Have been using it for some 6 months and it's been working flawlessly. As fast as the main SSD drive on that laptop.
customer_reviews.author: VladM

customer_reviews.title: I expect much better from SanDisk
customer_reviews.text: This thumb drive is unusable due to the heat issues. I wouldn't mind it getting hot provided it wasn't getting so hot during the transfers using USB 3.0 that the circuitry inside reaches its thermal limit and disconnects from the bus. I tried moving 16 GB of data onto this drive and it repeatedly failed at about 20% transferred. I expect much better from SanDisk. This drive was poorly engineered. Don't waste your time.
customer_reviews.author: Paul W.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, very fast, small, and low price
customer_reviews.text: I've nearly filled this drive to it's capacity. It's very fast for a USB drive and the end of it lights up when you plug it in. The cap fits securely and I was able to attack a lanyard to put it on my keychain. I used these: amazon.com/gp/product/B01MXPUAKT Some of the reviews said their device got hot. I'm not sure if they have fixed this, but mine never got very hot after transferring 60GB of files. I will probably buy another one at this price. Right now, this seems to be the best capacity and performance for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff W

customer_reviews.title: Excellent functionality. A lot of space! Good price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my vehicle. I put all my favorite music on it. I put 498 songs on it. That used up about 1 gig of the 32. I put some documents and pictures on it for safe keeping. I still have about 25 gigs of space to use. But the price is well worth it. I just may need that space someday. It’s the low profile I like the most. It’s in my car and you can’t even see it. So no one will be tempted to break in to steal it. Hear is a cool idea. Name the drive what you want and it will show up on your media screen. I call mine MUSTANG.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very HOT and SLOOWWWWWWWWW
customer_reviews.text: Initially this product worked great. But after a few uses, it started slowing down more and more.. Even after several zero outs and formats.. it runs EXTREMELY hot... This is mildly alarming, as we use these for vmware boot devices... I generally only see about 20mb/s after a fresh format, and only for about 2 gigs worth of transfer.. Currently sitting at 355 kb/s - 1 mb/s .... What a waste.. Now I have to figure out the best way to swap all these out... Buyer beware...
customer_reviews.author: gary

customer_reviews.title: I won't buy another SanDisk product if I can help it. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this drive very seldom. Every-time I do it is usually for short duration's. The last time I needed it was to make a Windows 10 install disk. It failed 4 times in a row due to an unknown error. When I pulled the drive I mildly burned my fingers. I googled it and saw that SanDisk had been aware of the problems with this drive since 2015. They still have the same issues with overheating today. This was the last drive to fail in 6 months along with 4 other Sandisk sd cards in various devices. I am convinced that they make cheap crap for high profit. No More.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Bad blocks right out of the package
customer_reviews.text: Fresh out of the package, device was formatted and I tried to perform a speed test using bonnie++ and failed during "Writing intelligently..." test in subsequent runs at block 2922166, 2922167, then finally "stuck" failing at 3483070 -- that's something like 1.7 GB in on a 32 GB drive. Fully patched Debian 9.5, AMD Ryzen 5 2600X, Asus ROG Strix B450-F Gaming motherboard, all known good with multiple other flash drives, including several SanDisk Extreme products.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Kletsky

customer_reviews.title: works as expected
customer_reviews.text: I tested it by writing and reading a 25 GB directory. Write speed was about 3.5 MB/s and read speed was about 100 MB/s. The drive didn't get hot as others reported. i like the small red LED indicator. The plastic protective cap fit too tight and was difficult to remove. Update. I bought another drive and did the same test. This time I measured 32 MB/s read speed. All other attributes were the same. Update. Just copied a 25 GB file and removed the drive quickly and almost burned my fingers. It can run very hot as others have said.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: The label says 64GB, the actual capacity is 32GB
customer_reviews.text: This Ultra Fit USB 3.0 Flash drive was supposed to be 64GB according to the listing, the packaging and the hetched numbers on the flash drive itself... however when inserted into the computer (Windows 10) the actual properties shows the capacity to be 32GB not 64GB as listed and as packaged... Was the hard drive inside this flash drive swapped with a smaller capacity on purpose? I'm going to try and get in touch with Amazon albeit late in the process...
customer_reviews.author: AlFa Man

customer_reviews.title: gets very hot for some reason
customer_reviews.text: I only used this drive couple of times. The main problem with it is that it becomes very hot when inserted into a computer, in fact, too hot to touch. No other drive heats up like this, so my constant concern was if my data is safe when it heats like this and if it can melt/damage the plastic around the USB slot of my computer/laptop. In the hindsight, I regret not returning it immediately since this issue prevented me from using it and resulted always choosing some other drive with this one being unused.
customer_reviews.author: Alex K

customer_reviews.title: Gets Very Hot and May Fry Itself
customer_reviews.text: This little USB stick seems like a good idea at first. It's small and doesn't stick out from a computer or laptop, and holds 64 GB. But it doesn't last long. From the very first use, it was always VERY HOT when I ejected it from the USB port. Hot enough to actually burn your fingers. After just a couple months of semi-regular use it started having read errors and eventually it just stopped working. The computer would not detect it anymore. I'm pretty sure it just overheated and fried itself. I have had much better luck with the larger, longer USB sticks from SanDisk.
customer_reviews.author: Brainiac

customer_reviews.title: Too small and cannot dissipate heat generated by USB port itself = OVERHEATING
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in HIGH hopes but it is so poorly designed. It all metal and very small. It fits all the way into the USB port and as it heats up the heat has NO where to go but into the internal chip so it OVER HEATS and your speed bogs and it stops and you wonder why. I got so mad I chucked it across the room. Because of its small size I never found it again to return it. lol. My loss. I will always buy a larger stick where the chip is not inside the USB port. OH, I really did like the SanDisk secure vault. That was awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Shane Gibby

customer_reviews.title: POOR QUALITY, DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of them last month, but today when I use them for the first time, I'm very disappointed and frustrated. The first one I tried on my laptop is the 16GB one, my computer couldn't even recognize it, when I removed it, it's extremely hot, then I tried it on another computer, it didn't show up either, still hot. So I tried the 128GB one, the exact same thing happend again. I've already thrown away the original boxes because I didn't even think about that these flash drives could be defective, now I cannot even return them !!! I promise I will not buy anything from SanDisk ever again!
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, features and price!
customer_reviews.text: Got this specifically for my Sony 2017 detachable face car receiver(USB 2.0). Fits great, very nice low profile once plugged in. Transferred about 16GB of MP3 files very fast over USB3.0 (I wasn't timing, but done in about a 5 minute smoke break). After extended use of hours of constant use, no temperature change of device noticed(I pulled it out and held in palm of hand). Seems to be made as well as all my other SanDisk products which I have owned and used for years. All of the many, many SanDisk products I own over 15+ years have been wonderfully made and lasted forever for standard use. Nice packaging and fast shipping!
customer_reviews.author: G-Man

customer_reviews.title: and that is very nice for transferring large amounts of data fast
customer_reviews.text: I average about 40MB/s transfer rate with this, and that is very nice for transferring large amounts of data fast. It's great for tablets as its doesn't stick out far at all. The only downside is that this thing gets very hot. I've got a windows tablet, and I can feel the heat radiating off it when watching videos. The metal sticks out a little, and even touching if for a few seconds starts to sting. It cools off pretty quick when not watching videos or transferring files though.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: A good permanent attachment
customer_reviews.text: Sandisk's 128 gb USB comes in at great value, so its perfect for some situations. If you want to extend your desktop capacity or run an operating system from this drive, it will work very well as long as you intent to keep it plugged in at all times. The speed for memory transfer is satisfactory and meets my expectations for USB 3.0. However, this does not make a good portable USB. Because its so small, its easy to lose or break, and it also heats up to surprising temperatures.
customer_reviews.author: Hayden Brandt

customer_reviews.title: Save yourself a trip to the post office!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a video professional constantly sending huge amounts of footage to clients. Instead of waiting in line at the post office and paying $10+ to ship a hard drive, I just format this Sandisk 128GB thumb drive for Mac, copy my footage (usually 40-100GB), toss two stamps on an envelope and leave it for my mailman to pick up. Works great! PS - scotch tape this to a business card before you put it in an envelope so it doesn't get lost when your recipient opens it. And give them a heads up that it is TINY. I know from experience these are easy to lose!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Frank

customer_reviews.title: Super Tiny
customer_reviews.text: This thing is super tiny and would fit in the palm of a cat's paw. Just like what people said though -- the metal part of the USB tends to get VERY HOT especially right after a file transfer so be careful. But I wouldn't say it's a design flaw since something so tiny wouldn't have much surface area to dissipate heat, so it's to be expected. This is handy for when you're on the go and need files on hand. I'm a photographer and having this on my keys gives me peace in mind knowing my work is close by.
customer_reviews.author: IG: @mistermajestic

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the little drives like this I bought a few years ago.
customer_reviews.text: This drive did very well at the job for which I used it. It wrote just as quickly as most of my larger ones. Accessing what I wrote is also no problem. It really has only one shortcoming and that is its size. I can't label it to indicate what I put on it. I have to save it for short term storage so I can remove the data before I forget what I put on it. It sure is great to carry a lot of files in avery small space. It fits a pocket well.
customer_reviews.author: B. Mc

customer_reviews.title: SanDisk is Best
customer_reviews.text: Best in class for USB power! With the small form factor, I leave this in my Macbook all the time as a "work folder." Great to easily pop out and have all my files with me, a low tech solution to cloud... and I have the security knowing all my content stays in my hands at all times. SanDisk memory has always run flawlessly for me, unlike cheaper brands I've tried through the years.
customer_reviews.author: johnnysausages

customer_reviews.title: Mine fell apart taking it out of the laptop. ...
customer_reviews.text: Mine fell apart taking it out of the laptop. I contacted sandisk and they did replace it, 5 year warranty. BUT, if that happens to you remember one thing, they tell you to send back all the pieces, I did, including the clear cover. When I got it back the protective cover that came with the drive was not sent back. Called them and they told me they only replace the drive itself and that probably the cover was disposed off, and could not replace the cover. I escalated the claim with them today, waiting to see how they answer that.
customer_reviews.author: Jose A. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this drive a week ago as an easy backup device
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this drive a week ago as an easy backup device. Upon first use, everything seems to be great and the drive works like a champ. After 5 days of use, the drive is now corrupt and not readable. When I insert it, windows recognizes its a removable drive, but cannot access it. We tried it on other computers in my office and noticed it was unreadable there as well. On the positive side, kudos to Amazon for taking this device back without a hassle!
customer_reviews.author: RizzoMokey

customer_reviews.title: write speed is only 2MB/s
customer_reviews.text: I tested on 3 computers with USB 3 port, transferring one large file around 9 GB. The initial write speed is 45 MB/s, after around 10 seconds the speed drop to around 2 MB/s. Totally defective! Update after I received the free replacement from Amazon: For the same 9GB large file, write speed is stable around 18 MB/s, occasionally drop to 9 MB/s. Overall much satisfied. Another note about exFAT. This drive is pre-formatted in exFAT. However, when I try to copy the 9GB file to it, Windows 10 prompt me the file is too large for the destination. I have to reformat it (still using exFAT). Then the copy operation is allowed.
customer_reviews.author: Y. WANG

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the car, fast and reliable.
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my car. It's way faster than my old 16 gig and takes up practically no space at all. That said, if you're prone to lose things, you may want to buy a USB with a key ring attachment because this guy is TINY. Thankfully, my ride can handle USB 3.0. Even if it couldn't, this is backwards compatible with USB 2.0.. Although I'm not exactly sure if that's a rare occurrence. Anyways, I dumped nearly all of my music collection on this thing and still have 35 free gigs. You can't beat that.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: This thing is HOT!
customer_reviews.text: It's very small. I love the form factor. Loaded one down with music for the car and it was scorching hot by the time it was done! Can't believe SanDisk put out something that gets so hot so quickly. Been using their products for decades. This is the first product that I do NOT trust to be plugged in unattended. It's a shame "Money isn't as important to our organization as knowing who to trust."
customer_reviews.author: LoganExplosion

customer_reviews.title: Great For Use As Backup Drive
customer_reviews.text: I use a MicroSD card as extended disk in a Windows 10 laptop and use this to back that disk up. Both stay in the computer. I wrote a script that copies everything from the extended disk to USB and used Task Manager to run it at login. Thus I've always got at least one backup. This SanDisk model is small enough that it just stays in the USB port and doesn't interfere with the carry case. It remains out of sight and stays in place. That's rather handy and also less damage prone.
customer_reviews.author: JP KazarianTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great for few small files, bad for large files or lots of small files.  Overheats and fails!
customer_reviews.text: Failed on about the third transfer of items with any real substance to them (approx 2GB, but thousands of files). The device heated up to the point that it was too hot to remove from the port. I let it cool down and it wouldn't work anymore to even transfer the files I had just copied onto it. I don't know if this is an issue with all 3.0 USB Flash Drives or just this one in particular, but I'd be very careful what you copy to this. Using it for a few small files here and there worked fine. Putting any stress on it at all made it fail and could have potentially caused other problems from the heat.
customer_reviews.author: Bacon Overlord

customer_reviews.title: Tiny; good price to capacity ratio
customer_reviews.text: Pluses: barely discernible when inserted into one of my laptop’s USB slots. Nice capacity; I am tired of small USB drives. Cons: so small and no way to secure it to a lanyard or clip, but I knew that when selected it. For now I just leave it inserted so I don’t lose it. The red activity LED is so small that it’s generally unnoticeable. I’m glad not to be blinded by a LED activity indicator, but this is a bit too understated. I am not blown away by write speeds when large files/numbers of files are involved. But again, as long as this drive holds the amount of data I bought it for, the speed is acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Mike The D.

customer_reviews.title: Works, but has performance issues when getting hot
customer_reviews.text: This drive definitely works, and I've been using it successfully as extra storage semi permanently on my laptop. But it does get quite hot, especially under continual load. I actually started to have applications become unresponsive on me after some heavy use, necessitating moving that data to a different drive that can take the frequent read/writes. If you're looking for occasional access, this is a fine drive. If you want something to consistently read/write from in nonstop fashion, you need to look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Angela M.

customer_reviews.title: Broken USB pins Twice
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this flash drive, it has some seriously bad quality control issues, I love the size and everything about it but the pins that connect it to a usb slot have bent and 3.0 compatibility does not work anymore. I have contacted sandisk and they have replaced it under their warranty but that only took 3 weeks and with in a week of getting it back its broken again. I'm not the only one with this issue, my friend has this same issue having his pins bending and making it unusable with 3.0 compatibility.
customer_reviews.author: PresRes

customer_reviews.title: it worked perfectly fine. I am docking a star for the heat ...
customer_reviews.text: Most definitely DOES work in my car. If you are having issues with this in your car audio system, format the drive to FAT32 and try again. When I received it, the device-default setting is exFAT. This did not work in my car (2016 Scion iA). After quick-formatting to FAT32 and trying again, it worked perfectly fine. I am docking a star for the heat issues. When transferring files via my PC. this drive gets much more hot than my 32GB 3.0 Lexar. However, the long-term negatives of this in my car are yet to be seen. I love that it doesn't have any flashing lights or otherwise distracting "features" while transmitting data.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: It's Just Gonna Be For Music Anyway...
customer_reviews.text: I'm reserving the last star as this is a birthday gift for a family member to be given next week. I've collected close to 17GB worth of music they enjoy and stored it on here with virtually no problems as mentioned in other reviews. I'll keep a close ear on how well this works over the coming weeks, but for now, other than the rather small size and difficulty attaching a lanyard or keyring to the drive, this fits the bill. They might just insert the thing and leave it there, for all I may know...
customer_reviews.author: o'darque hunnett

customer_reviews.title: It died after a few months of use
customer_reviews.text: I finally gave up trying to revive this POS. It died after a few months of use for system backup drive for my NVidia shield TV unit. I kept trying to revive using many different system utilities to maybe fix the partition table/recreate partition/re-format the drive. Every one of them failed to fix the problem. For some reason the drive became write protected when it died. So nothing works. I give up. Do NOT Buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: It runs warm AND it's a good thumb drive w/ 5-year warranty
customer_reviews.text: Agree with the above reviews that the unit generates a good amount of heat, during operation. However, the transfers are reasonably fast for a USB 3.0 device and the capacity allows my to bring A LOT of media and work-related materials along with me, wherever I go. Does it get warm, you bet. Is it unsafe, nope. I transferred 4GB of documents etc and pulled it right out of the slot and it didn't burn me... it was pretty warm. The capacity, speed and form factor are not going to allow for fast heat disipation.... it's a trade off. But the small size makes it super-convenient to carry on a key ring, as I do.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Hot flash drive
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 64GB version to make the Linux Mint persistent Live USB. While the speeds were pretty good (91.6MBps & 9.45MBps read & write, respectively), this little thing got hot so fast that it froze my laptop after transferring about 10GB of data from the laptop to it. I had to remove the flash drive, reset the laptop and wait for roughly 5 minutes for the flash drive to cool down before it started to work again. Also, as other reviewers mentioned, when the flash drive got warm, it slowed down remarkably. Next time I will try the Samsung fit drives to see if they're better.
customer_reviews.author: SB LEO

customer_reviews.title: wait for it to cool down and plug it back in again
customer_reviews.text: This USB heats up after about a minute of transfering files to the point where it burns me when I try to pull it out. I can't imagine what it'll do the the USB port it's plugged into. I also had an issue serveral times where while it is transferring files, it will say USB device not recognized and I have to take it out, wait for it to cool down and plug it back in again. I think that problem is with how small the USB is. I have been buying the longer USBs ever since.
customer_reviews.author: N. R.

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for six months, unfortunately after six months it died
customer_reviews.text: I was using this exclusively in my car as the drive for the dashcam, and it worked fine. I noticed it stopped working so I connected it to my computer to see what was wrong, and the drive is inaccessible. It shows up in Explorer, but there's nothing on it. Chkdsk doesn't recognize it, none of the tools work, it doesn't show up in Disk Management, I tried in two different computers just in case one of the ports wasn't working properly, the drive is just dead. Thankfully I only lost about 10 bucks on it, but very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn K.

customer_reviews.title: Dropbox files without worry about using up laptop storage
customer_reviews.text: Found the idea online, to put the dropbox app and file structure on a storage device. This was perfect and unobtrusive when plugged into my macbook - so I can easily drop the laptop into the carrying case without need to unplug this device. Before this switch, I was always running low on disk space (I only have 250 GB, so nice having it at 50% full vs 90%). Have yet to run out of space for my dropbox items.
customer_reviews.author: sewnski

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for continuous backup of my laptop
customer_reviews.text: I put this small USB flash drive in my laptop to use as a backup for all my documents and photos. I love that I don’t have to remove it after use and can leave it in and not worry about hitting it or losing it when traveling. Very dependable, have had this one for quite awhile and quite frankly forgot it was in its port! I would definitely buy one again, dependable and large capacity.
customer_reviews.author: KindleDiva

customer_reviews.title: Holds everything that I need with plently of space
customer_reviews.text: The 128 gb is fantastic. I have it always in my laptop, and it comfortably holds all my music, photos, and documents with plenty of extra space. The only problem is when I'm using it heavily or transferring large files, it does heat up like crazy. So if you're planning on transferring like 10 movies into this thing, I recommend doing it one by one with some time in between to let it cool down. Read a few reviews about burns and stuff melting, and honestly, I wouldn't be surprised if that happens. Just don't substitute this for a proper external hard drive and be careful with those big file transfers.
customer_reviews.author: jc

customer_reviews.title: VERY, VERY SLOOOOOWWWW and gets HOT to touch
customer_reviews.text: It took several attempts to get a good drive. Due to their size, I think they can be bent very easily. I have a USB 3.1 speed machine. I formatted the 128GB drive on the PC and copied about 4GB of data. Slow does not describe how long it took. 6MB/s for a USB 3.0 device... Pathetic. Then after the files were copied the drive was SUPER hot. It practically burned my finger. This is going back to Amazon. I give up on the Ultra small drives.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Guy

customer_reviews.title: The only USB drives I buy anymore
customer_reviews.text: I swear by these little guys. They're affordable, super low profile, reliable, and fast. I use them on my PS4, in my car stereo to hold MP3s, to transfer pictures between computers in the house, and document archival. There's little to no risk of it being snapped off of the port and they're almost invisible unless you're looking for it. There are many options out there but I keep finding new uses for these and buying more, they even make great gifts for the holidays when sending out family photos.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Dead after exFAT format, but support replaced with a different product
customer_reviews.text: Updating my review. Customer support at Sandisk was helpful with their RMA. They were not able to give me the exact same product as a replacement, but they worked to make me at least content with the product I have now. Old: I haven't even had it a month, started using it, reformatted to exFAT and it's just dead, the computers won't even recognize it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M Malovrh

customer_reviews.title: Won't last a year
customer_reviews.text: The description said it's mac compatible, but when I plugged it to one of the USB port, the SanDisk flash drive was not recognized at all and got really warm. I tried a different USB port (even though both should be USB 3), and while it didn't get warm, it still didn't recognize the flash drive until I formatted it in Disk Utilities. Other than the hiccup, it's working fine. ------- Update: the usb died completely after 10 months, and I only started to use it daily in the past 3 months. Before that, it was only used once or twice a month.
customer_reviews.author: J. W

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these thumb drives, and was initially please with price-performance-capacity. The drive is very hot, I wouldn't say it burns my fingers but definitely uncomfortable to the point that right after pulling it out you want to set it on the desk for a few seconds before handling. Sadly one of the thumb drives failed after only 2 years, I probably did 95% reading and 5% writing on it.
customer_reviews.author: Chiara Acquati

customer_reviews.title: Mine failed
customer_reviews.text: So this failed on me, granted I was using it as a HDD. I have done this many times in the past with no issues using WinToGo but for some reason this 64gb card keeps having boot issues. My buddy has the same setup and no issues so I think I just got a defective card as no matter what I do I will get an error code and my replacement flash drive works (different brand), Probably just bad luck but they do fail!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle R McCombs

customer_reviews.title: Getting the plastic model not metal version listed
customer_reviews.text: Just a heads up. The metal version in the description is not the one for sale. I’ve ordered it three times and they keep sending me the newer plastic version which is a piece of crap and the housing falls apart after being slotted into my computer or XBox. If your putting it somewhere cool and not moving it around constantly your fine but for everyday use go for a metal version. I still have all my metal ones and they’re solid. I’m not sure if the seller knows the difference but the add page tells you there is a newer version (the plastic one) available.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the best but def worth it for the money
customer_reviews.text: These speeds are with my Microsoft Surface Pro 3 (i7, 8gb ram, 512gb ssd) via USB 3.0 port Single file Copying to the USB = around 50 MB/s Copying from the USB = around 90 MB/s Multiple files Copying to the USB = around 40 MB/s Copying from the USB = around 75 MB/s Update: IT GETS HOT!!! It gets to the point I dropped them a couole of time after taking out of the laptop
customer_reviews.author: JKS

customer_reviews.title: Stay away.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Second drive died after about the same amount of use. Never had such poor luck with a USB device. Drive was dead after less than its capacity in transfers. Used it maybe 4/5 times before it just stopped working on any machine. Bought two & the other still works but has only seen about as much use. Will update if that one dies, too. As w/ other reviews: They do get extremely hot. Use below tip to keep from burning yourself. P.S. Recommend buying a set of lanyards for these. You can pull them out w/o burning yourself and they're very easy to lose.
customer_reviews.author: Nick P

customer_reviews.title: It small, works great if you don't use it much.
customer_reviews.text: Hi, Ok, if you don't us it much, this is product for you. If you do use it, need it every time, and want it attached to key chain. Do not buy it. I over heats, plastic slips off the end and depressor part that usb press on make connection floats around, trying for it into your computer, it will get stuck or breaker the usb port. How could Sandisk fix it? All metal, 2 parts, head with fine grooves made copper dispense heat, snap on to the usb part.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy A. Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: I loved the size of the stick, and the memory, It was my favorite, UNTIL! One day it decided to blow up, die, whatever you want to say. All my data was gone. Because of the size of it, it is almost impossible to recover the data. I could have filed a warranty claim, but, what would that? My data was gone, and I learned a lesson, to stick with the 64GB and smaller. Maybe someday I will try a 128GB again.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Great iTunes external drive
customer_reviews.text: Fits snuggly and unintrusively with my 13" macbook. It's almost too small and easier to get lost but I make sure I keep it stored in a carrying case. Works ok for storing my iTunes library but still when updating song titles or adding album art it kinda slows down and I have to wait a second or two for flash drive to write info before advancing to next song. However when playing music it works great and slower write speed when adding music art doesn't affect music when playing songs.
customer_reviews.author: 4 Mile Gym

customer_reviews.title: Not sure how to top this one...
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite USB "sticks" (Flash Memory Devices) by far. Tight profile allows me to keep them seated in my gear at all times and the size/speed is great. I wish they'd make larger sizes, but it appears they've only made larger sizes available in a different form factor (plastic... no thanks), so this 128gb size will have to do. When I need a new USB drive... I always buy one of these.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution for enhancing Ultrabooks storage
customer_reviews.text: Good small USB drive that stays in the laptop. Speeds are consistent with USB 3.0 and provides a useful alternative to the typical external drives. The only thing I would like to see, if possible is to have less of a protrusion from the laptop. I'm not sure if this is possible with the brand of laptop and it may be there is nothing available that would get as close as I would like. This drive is recommended and something I would purchase again. Price and performance this drive is the best way to increase storage on these Ultrabook laptops that only ave 128 GB internal.
customer_reviews.author: dcpaint

customer_reviews.title: Lasts about 1 year
customer_reviews.text: I've owned three of these and they all fail after about a year. Why do I keep buying them? They are small and I leave it in my laptop even when traveling. I just don't keep anything important on them and just use them as a junk area when I need extra space, but I have run VM's off the USB and it works fine. As the other reviewers have noted, it runs EXTREMELY hot and it can burn you (it's not hot enough to combust most items you'd have around it though.
customer_reviews.author: st0rmbringer

customer_reviews.title: Using as ReadyBoost drive,  Good value, working well... temp staying around 110 degrees
customer_reviews.text: I still have a couple of computers with standard hard drives (not SSD) and wanted to speed up the systems using Windows 10 & ReadyBoost feature.. so this flash drive stays in place for dedicated system use. So far no problems and heat is nothing to worry about at only 11-12 degrees F above body temperature. If you use for ReadyBoost, be sure to format the Flash drive for either NTSF or exFAT and set for only ReadyBoost use so you can use more than 4 Gb... using NTSF I'm seeing almost 29 Gb of usable space
customer_reviews.author: Careful Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great USB Drive
customer_reviews.text: I do like SanDisk USB drives. I bought this to use with my Roku TV and have the ability to pause live TV from my OTA antenna. Works perfectly and the price was not too bad. I am older, so I remember paying almost $200 for my first 1GB (Yes, that is one gig) USB stick. Times have changed. I did not rate Tech Support as I did not need them.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK.  IT WILL LITERALLY BURN YOU.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY. It does not work on Windows 10, although you don't find that out until you plug it in and read the PDF. The "update" failed, then disappeared and I was left with two PDF documents and that is all. I was unable to find it on my devices on my computer, because it bogged down my computer and it could never get there. It was in my computer for about 10 minutes and when I went to take it out it BURNED me! This is not a good product. It cannot be returned. Amazon made good on it and refunded my money. This should definitely be taken off the market.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. H

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed - Avoid These USB stick
customer_reviews.text: I have always bought sandisk and they have been great but i bought 2 of these and both were bad, When i plugged them in my other usb devices on my new computer started having connection issues, When i removed the drove it was HOT to the touch, to hot for a usb port and to risky. I see the new model has similar issues and im going to try another brand until a new design is released and reviewed
customer_reviews.author: W. M. C.

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect. I don't see much of a speed difference ...
customer_reviews.text: I have this in my laptop and I never take it out. I have an SSD that I dual boot off and have this in one of my USB 3.0. This is my default store for data whether in Linux or Windows. This is perfect. I don't see much of a speed difference when running processes through my computer on either operating system. Love that this is so small and gives me enough space. There is the issue of heat and there was once when I removed it and the metal casing was warm. Not a downside for me since I leave it plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: Deathpool

customer_reviews.title: This drive is definitely fast and has good storage, but it has one major flaw that ...
customer_reviews.text: This drive is definitely fast and has good storage, but it has one major flaw that keeps me from rating it any higher. If you are transferring large files it gets so hot that it will actually hit thermal limits and shut itself off. Even with smaller files if it is transferring for more than a minute or so it gets too hot to touch. I think this is more of an issue of the small size than anything else, it just doesn't have the thermal capacity to keep itself cool.
customer_reviews.author: J. Weathermon

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy as a long term solution!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 128 GB version of this flash drive a few years ago and now after limited use over the years it has stopped working. I believe it could be due to how hot the device gets. When copying data to the drive now it disconnects/reconnects to the machine in a loop that causes the data copy to fail. If you need this for a short term solution it could work but don't plan in it lasting long!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: So tiny to give so much peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: I am so over my laptop's crashing. In the last 10 years I've had to go through four of them. And what's really upsetting is that they usually crash right after their warranty is over. And it's not like I buy cheap laptops. That being said I went ahead and invested in this and so far it has really giving me peace of mind. The ScanDisk brand is reliable and you get plenty of memory for an extremely reasonable price. I would highly recommend everyone has it attached to their laptop for backup that doesn't take any space.
customer_reviews.author: ToddlersMom

customer_reviews.title: Wrong amount of free space compared to advertised
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 128 gb thumb drive, everything works fine with it, but before I put anything on it, fresh out of the box, it said there was only 114 gb free on the drive, when there was supposed to be 128. This confuses me a little bit, that is a big discrepancy in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Zach S.

customer_reviews.title: Great for low profile work.
customer_reviews.text: Been using this to play all my tunes in the USB port of my Mitsubishi Outlander Sport. Sadly, 32GB is as capacious as Mitsubishi's system allows (I found out after tring the 64GB version). Always read the owners manual first, kids. The USB port is in the armrest compartment and this drive barely sticks up from the port so it does get bumped like a regular flash drive. You have to be careful when you carry this around as it is VERY small and can get lost more easily than a regular thumb drive.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Fastner

customer_reviews.title: Low Profile USB drive. Works Great
customer_reviews.text: works very well. I bought this to store movies and pictures in the back of my Samsung Smart TV. It's difficult to have a longer one sticking out the back of the TV when it's hung on the wall. This USB flash drive is very low profile and suits it's purpose very well. Warning: It's small and you could easily misplace this unit on your messy desk. Or, at least, on my messy desk... but I found it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Good capacity in a little package
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to load and run various Linux distros on a MBook Pro. Its small profile lets me keep it plugged in even when storing the laptop in its travel sleeve. It's tiny and solid and USB3 rated = fast. One reservation: I wouldn't carry it loose, it would be too easy to misplace or lose. I've nothing to say about tech support as I've not had reason to seek it.
customer_reviews.author: MacadamiaMac

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - SLOW, HOT and not worth it.  It is a steaming pile of failure.
customer_reviews.text: This is the WORST flash Drive I have ever seen. I am not an engineer but I am pretty sure that 200 degrees F is not an acceptable temperature for a device to be achieving (however, this IS it's greatest achievement). This drive is terribly slow because it gets so hot - you LITERALLY burn yourself if you pull it out. It crashes, because of overheating, and in my opinion is a safety hazard. If Sandisk does not replace these 2 I bought with something less hazardous to my health, I will never buy another Sandisk product again.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Walker

customer_reviews.title: Storage
customer_reviews.text: This is the third 128gb flash drive that I have purchased. I know that some of the memory is used for various reasons but 14gb. I usually purchase SanDisk because I trust that they make quality products. This is the first flash drive using that much memory. I can understand 5gb but not 14gb. This is the first time that I have purchased an Ultra Fit, also. I had a difficult time getting the plastic cover off of it. Then I had a problem getting it out of the usb port. It amazes me at how small physically these have gotten while increasing the memory capacity.
customer_reviews.author: WhatMeThinks

product_meta.title: SanDisk Ultra Fit 128GB USB 3.0 Flash Drive - SDCZ43-128G-GAM46
product_meta.description: Size:128GBThis ultra‐small, low‐profile USB 3.0 drive stays put for extra storage or moves media super‐fast between devices. Now you can transfer a full‐length movie in less than 30 seconds, enjoy write speeds up to 15 times faster than standard USB 2.0 drives and count on ever‐present storage that is designed to stay put.
feature_bullets: An ultra‐small, low‐profile, high‐speed USB 3.0 flash drive that's ideal for notebooks
The fast way to move media between your devices
Write up to 15X faster than standard USB 2.0 drives
Transfer a full‐length movie faster than standard USB 2.0 drives
Keep private files private with included SanDisk SecureAccess software

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars16,799 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
